Title.evidence: A multicenter, within-patient, evaluator-blinded, randomized-controlled trial

Trial_Design.evidence: A multicenter, within-patient, evaluator-blinded, randomized-controlled trial was conducted of 65 patients

Participants.evidence: 65 patients with acute, nonthermal, full-thickness skin defects requiring autografting

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to concurrently receive a predefined standard-of-care meshed STSG (control) or ASCS + more widely meshed STSG (ASCS+STSG)

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that the clinical performance of ASCS would be similar for soft tissue reconstruction of nonburn wounds.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Coprimary endpoints were noninferiority of ASCS+STSG for complete treatment area closure by Week 8, and superiority for relative reduction in donor skin area.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: two treatment areas were randomly assigned

Number_Analysed.evidence: complete closure was observed for 58% of control areas compared with 65% of ASCS+STSG areas

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 8 weeks, complete closure was observed for 58% of control areas compared with 65% of ASCS+STSG areas ( p = 0.005), establishing noninferiority of ASCS+STSG. On average, 27.4% less donor skin was required with ASCS+ STSG, establishing superiority over control ( p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: The treatment approaches had similar long-term scarring outcomes and safety profiles, with no unanticipated events and no serious ASCS device-related events.
